dt: {bc}a usually 2-wheeled vehicle for artillery ammunition attachable to a horse-drawn limber
{bc}a watertight chamber used in construction work under water or as a foundation
{bc}a hollow floating box or a boat used as a floodgate for a dock or basin

et: French, from Middle French, from Old Occitan, from {it}caissa{/it} chest, from Latin {it}capsa{/it} {ma}{mat|case|}{/ma}
shortdef: a usually 2-wheeled vehicle for artillery ammunition attachable to a horse-drawn limber; also : a limber with its attached caisson
a watertight chamber used in construction work under water or as a foundation
